candidates.why: Closest execution-oriented command that accepts file input, builds a unified execution prompt, and tracks progress.
Full workflow executor with session discovery/resume patterns and optional commit behavior; good for execution-loop structure.
Iterative multi-agent execution loop with resumability, artifact writing, and structured progress tracking.
File-driven workflow command; useful for argument parsing and file reading conventions.
Consumes external file artifacts and coordinates multi-step work; useful for multi-phase structure conventions.

selected.why: Best match for file-driven execution orchestration + unified prompt building; extend with unified event-log/session model.
